column1: '''Gandalf's Reflection''' is the second part of the seventh track on ''[[The Hobbit: The Complete Original Soundtrack]]'' from the [[1977]] [[The Hobbit (1977 film)|film adaptation]]
column2: paired with "[[That's What Bilbo Baggins Hates]]." Adapted from the poem "[[Far over the misty mountains cold]]" by [[Jules Bass]] with its music composed by [[Maury Laws]]
column3: only the first and last stanzas are actually sung; the rest is performed as a recitation by [[Gandalf]].

column1: ==Lyrics==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Far o'er the Misty Mountains cold
To dungeons deep and caverns old.
We must away ere break of day
To seek the pale
The dwarves of yore made mighty spells
While hammers fell like ringing bells
In places deep
In hollow halls beneath the fells.
Goblets they carved there for themselves
And harps of gold; where no man delves
There lay they long
Was sung unheard by men or elves.
For ancient king and elvish lord
There many a gleaming golden hoard
They shaped and wrought
To hide in gems on hilt of sword.
On silver necklaces they strung
The flowering stars
The dragon-fire
They meshed the light of moon and sun.
The pines were roaring on the height
The winds were moaning in the night.
The fire was red
The trees like torches blazed with light.
The bells were ringing in the dale
And men they looked up with faces pale;
The dragonâ€™s ire more fierce than fire
Laid low their towers and houses frail.
The mountain smoked beneath the moon;
The dwarves they heard the tramp of doom.
They fled their hall to dying fall
Beneath his feet
We must away ere break of day
To win our harps of gold from him!
</poem>
